derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in sense 3): from Latin saltatio(n-), from saltare 'to dance', frequentative of salire 'to leap'

means.word_mean: 1. (geology) the leaping movement of sand or soil particles as they are transported in a fluid medium over an uneven surface
2. a mutation that drastically changes the phenotype of an organism or species

sentences.sentence: "a successful leap from college to the major leagues"

means.word_mean: 4. taking a series of rhythmical steps (and movements) in time to music
5. a light springing movement upwards or forwards
